en.title: Saying Goodbye to Your Cat: Spending the Final Moments in Peace
en.content:
Parting with a beloved cat is heartbreaking, but it helps to know how to prepare for a peaceful farewell.

Signs of End of Life

You may observe changes such as refusing all food, no longer drinking water, decreased body temperature, changes in breathing, seeking hiding places, and becoming less responsive.

Home Hospice Care

Place your cat in a quiet, warm spot and wrap them in a soft blanket. Do not force-feed; simply moistening their lips is sufficient care. Being by their side, speaking gently, and petting them is the greatest comfort you can provide.

Consulting Your Veterinarian

If your cat is in severe pain, consult your veterinarian about palliative care such as pain medication. If necessary, it is important to have an honest discussion with your vet about the option of euthanasia.

Coping with Pet Loss

Grief is a natural emotion. Allow yourself to fully mourn. Creating a memory album, writing a letter, or talking with others who have had similar experiences can be healing. Consulting a pet loss counseling specialist is also a good option.

zh.title: 猫咪的临终关怀与告别：让最后的时光平静而温暖
zh.content:
与爱猫的离别令人心痛，但提前了解如何让它平静地走完最后一程，是我们能做的最好准备。

临终前的征兆

可能观察到的变化包括：完全不吃东西、不再喝水、体温下降、呼吸变化、试图躲藏、反应迟钝等。

居家临终护理

将猫咪安置在安静温暖的地方，用柔软的毯子包裹。不要强迫进食，用棉签沾水湿润嘴唇即可。陪伴在身边，轻声呼唤，温柔地抚摸，就是最好的关怀。

与兽医沟通

如果猫咪疼痛严重，请咨询兽医关于缓和治疗（如镇痛药）的方案。必要时，坦诚地与兽医讨论安乐死这一选择也很重要。

面对宠物离世的悲伤

悲伤是自然的情感，请允许自己充分地悲伤。制作回忆相册、写一封信、与有相同经历的人交流，都有助于治愈。也可以向宠物丧亲咨询专家寻求帮助。
